ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Read interesting articles, I guess? I would recommend it to another student, though since everyone has to take it or American, I'm not sure how meaningful such a criterion is.
well it gives some non-quantitative economics flavor.
Recommended. Essential for the deeper study of economics and also a requirement.
It is a course that gets you to know the big picture about European econ history from Black Death until WWI. Informative, but requires a lot of reading.
I would recommend the course. It requires a great amount of time to do the readings and the papers, but it is an interesting course even if you are not into history in general.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It made me realize that while I greatly enjoy reading economic history articles, I don't want to do economic history research, which was pretty valuable! Not a knock on the class, just saying that it helped me discover my personal preferences, which was valuable. And I learned a lot of things that will be helpful in thinking about my chosen fields.
it was a nice experience taking this course.
Provided plenty of experience of research and review related to my discipline. The course contributed a lot.
I don't know how much did this course help me deepen my knowledge in Economics, but it did help me have more sense of some important events related to it.
